TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Click any of the icon to start the experiment
Take out the disposable syringe from its packet.
Fill 1-ml syringe with injectate.
Remove the air bubbles in the syringe as shown.
Take 70% ethanol on a gauze sponge.
Take out the mouse from its cage.
Hold the tail of the mouse using left hand and pick the mouse by holding its neck with the right hand.
Keep the mouse straight in the hand holding its neck tightly.
Swab the heavy musculature of its upper thigh using gauze sponge.
Now insert the needle slowly.
Swab the injected area once again using the sponge.
Put back the mouse into its cage.
Take Anesthesia chamber,Isoflurane,Injectate,Ethanol,Disposable syringe and Clippers to conduct the experiment.
Open the lid of the anesthesia chamber.
Place some gauze sponge on the chamber as shown.
Take few drops of Isoflurane.
Drop it into the top of the sponge in the chamber.
Keep a grid on top of the sponge as shown.
Close the lid of the chamber.
Allow the isoflurane to spread all over the chamber.
Pick a mouse from its cage as shown.
Put the mouse into the chamber and close its lid.
After 10 minutes, we can observe that the mouse faints.
Pick the mouse from the chamber.
Now, restrain the animal on a table.
Use clippers to remove hair from an area on the back
Put 70% ethanol on a gauze sponge.
Now, swab the hair removed area with the same gauze sponge.
Fill the syringe with injectate.
Pull the skin taut with one hand and insert the needle, bevel up and at a shallow angle, just under the superficial layer of epidermis.
Swab the injected area once again with gauze sponge.
Put the mouse in an oxygen chamber.
After sometime, mouse will get back to its conscious state.
Now, take out the mouse from the oxygen chamber.
Take out the disposable syringe from its packet.
Fill 1-ml syringe with injectate.
Remove the air bubbles in the syringe as shown.
Take 70% ethanol on a gauze sponge
Take out the mouse from its cage.
Pick the mouse by tightly holding its neck with the right hand and then keeping its tail on the small finger.
Insert the needle under the skin of the interscapular area tented by the restraining thumb and forefinger.
Swab the injected area with gauze sponge.
Put back the mouse in its cage.
Place the mouse in a restrainer.
Close the restrainer to tighten the mouse as shown.
Dip the tip of the tail of the mouse into a beaker contains warm water.
Hold the tail of the mouse and swab the tail with 70% ethanol on a gauze sponge.
Now, insert the needle parallel to the vein 2 to 4 mm into the lumen.
Swab the tail with 70% ethanol on a gauze sponge.
Take Ethanol, Disposable syringe, Injectate to conduct the experiment.
Hold the tail of the mouse using left hand.
Now, pick the mouse by holding its neck with the right hand.
Hold the mouse tightly in the right hand, exposing the animal's abdomen, tilting the head downward as shown.
Swab the lower quadrant of the abdomen using a gauze sponge.
Insert needle into the lower left or right quadrant of the abdomen, avoiding the abdominal midline.
Swab the abdomen once again.
Put back the mouse in its cage.
Swab the left footpad of the mouse using a gauze sponge.
Spread the toes of one the swabbed foot and introduce the needle into the soft tissue pad of the plantar surface from the ventral side.
Apply direct pressure following withdrawal of needle.
Swab the injected area once more using gauze sponge.
Put back the mouse in its cage.
Take Anesthesia chamber,Iris scissor,Scalpel,Isoflurane,Disposable syringe and Ethanol to conduct the experiment.
Place some gauze sponge on the chamber as shown.
Immobilize in dorsal recumbency on a surgical board as shown.
Take 70% ethanol on a gauze sponge.
Swab the chest area with the sponge.
Take a scalpel.
Make a 1-cm midline incision with scalpel and blade at the thoracic inlet ; at the junction of the lower cervical and upper thoracic regions.
Take an iris scissor.
Now, longitudinally bisect the upper one-third of the sternum
Fill syringe with injectate and remove air bubbles.
Expose the thymus using forceps as shown.
Insert needle into the parenchyma of the thymus and inject.
Repeat the same for the other side.
Now, close wound with wound clips.
Put the mouse in an oxygen chamber.
After sometime, mouse will get back to its conscious state.
Now, take out the mouse from the oxygen chamber.
